Docs.param: The source buffer from which UTF-16 text is read.
The destination buffer to which ASCII text is written.
When this method returns, contains the number of bytes actually written to . It's the same as the number of chars actually read from .
Docs.summary: Copies text from a source buffer to a destination buffer, converting from UTF-16 to ASCII during the copy.
Docs.returns: An describing the result of the operation.

.method public static hidebysig valuetype System.Buffers.OperationStatus ToLower(valuetype System.ReadOnlySpan`1<unsigned int8> source, valuetype System.Span`1<unsigned int8> destination, [out] int32& bytesWritten) cil managed

static member ToLower : ReadOnlySpan<byte> * Span<byte> * int -> System.Buffers.OperationStatus
public: static System::Buffers::OperationStatus ToLower(ReadOnlySpan<System::Byte> source, Span<System::Byte> destination, [Runtime::InteropServices::Out] int % bytesWritten);

Docs.param: The source buffer from which ASCII text is read.
The destination buffer to which lowercase text is written.
When this method returns, contains the number of bytes actually written to . It's the same as the number of bytes actually read from .
Docs.summary: Copies text from a source buffer to a destination buffer, converting ASCII letters to lowercase during the copy.
Docs.returns: An describing the result of the operation.
Docs.remarks: The source and destination spans must not overlap. If they do, an will be thrown. If you want to mutate the span in-place, use the method instead.
